items.title: Chinese APT Uses OSS & PoCs to Spy on Other Countries
items.excerpt: "RedNovember" is both lazy and punctual: always quick to do its homework on new vulnerabilities, but always getting the answers from cyber defenders.

items.title: As Incidents Rise, Japanese Government's Cybersecurity Falls Short
items.excerpt: The Japanese government suffered the most cybersecurity incidents in 2024 — 447, nearly double the previous year — while failing to manage 16% of critical systems.

items.title: SEO Poisoning Campaign Tied to Chinese Actor
items.excerpt: In Operation Rewrite, an unspecified actor is using legitimate compromised Web servers to deliver malicious content to visitors for financial gain.

items.title: GitHub Aims to Secure Supply Chain as NPM Hacks Ramp Up
items.excerpt: GitHub will address weak authentication and overly permissive tokens in the NPM ecosystem, following high-profile threat campaigns like those involving Shai-Hulud malware.

items.title: From FBI to CISO: Unconventional Paths to Cybersecurity Success
items.excerpt: Cybersecurity leader Jason Manar shares insights on diverse career paths, essential skills, and practical advice for entering and thriving in the high-stress yet rewarding field of cybersecurity.

items.excerpt: The for-hire platform leverages legitimate cloud-native tools to make detection and disruption harder for defenders and SOC analysts.

items.title: Iran-Linked Hackers Target Europe With New Malware
items.excerpt: "Nimbus Manticore" is back at it, this time with improved variants of its flagship malware and targets that are outside its usual focus area.

items.title: Attackers Use Phony GitHub Pages to Deliver Mac Malware
items.excerpt: Threat actors are using a large-scale SEO poisoning campaign and fake GitHub repositories to deliver Atomic infostealers to Mac users.

items.title: Airport Chaos Shows Human Impact of 3rd-Party Attacks
items.excerpt: Major EU airports such as Heathrow were disrupted over the weekend after a cyberattack hit the provider of check-in kiosk software, which caused delays and flight cancellations.

items.title: 15 Years of Zero Trust: Why It Matters More Than Ever
items.excerpt: With the emergence of AI-driven attacks and quantum computing, and the explosion of hyperconnected devices, zero trust remains a core strategy for security operations.

items.title: Zero Trust: Strengths and Limitations in the AI Attack Era
items.excerpt: Zero Trust could help organizations fight back against attackers who use artificial intelligence, but new threats will require the architecture to evolve.

items.title: Transforming Cyber Frameworks to Take Control of Cyber-Risk
items.excerpt: Frameworks may seem daunting to implement — especially for government IT teams that may not have an abundance of resources and expertise. But beginning implementation is better than never starting.

items.title: 'ShadowLeak' ChatGPT Attack Allows Hackers to Invisibly Steal Emails
items.excerpt: The loophole allows cyberattackers to exfiltrate company data via OpenAI's infrastructure, leaving no trace at all on enterprise systems.

items.title: Plastic People, Plastic Cards: Synthetic Identities Plague Finance & Lending Sector
items.excerpt: Following a pandemic-era respite, financial fraud linked to synthetic identities is rising again, with firms potentially facing $3.3 billion in damages from new accounts.

items.title: Patch Now: Max-Severity Fortra GoAnywhere Bug Allows Command Injection
items.excerpt: Exploitation of the flaw, tracked as CVE-2025-10035, is highly dependent on whether systems are exposed to the Internet, according to Fortra.

items.title: Iranian State APT Blitzes Telcos & Satellite Companies
items.excerpt: A Charming Kitten subgroup is performing some of the most bespoke cyberattacks ever witnessed in the wild, to down select high-value targets.

items.title: Critical Azure Entra ID Flaw Highlights Microsoft IAM Issues
items.excerpt: While the cloud vulnerability was fixed prior to disclosure, the researcher who discovered it says it could have led to catastrophic attacks, alarming some in the security community.

items.title: Capture-the-Flag Competition Leads to Cybersecurity Career
items.excerpt: As Splunk celebrates the 10th anniversary of Boss of the SOC competition, it continues to be a valuable platform for security professionals to test their skills, learn new techniques, and potentially advance their careers.

items.title: TikTok Deal Won't End Enterprise Risks
items.excerpt: The proposed restructuring plan would address many concerns related to the social media platform, but risks remain for security teams.

items.title: SonicWall Breached, Firewall Backup Data Exposed
items.excerpt: Threat actors breached the MySonicWall service and accessed backup firewall configuration files belonging to "fewer than 5%" of its install base, according to the company.

items.title: 7 Lessons for Securing AI Transformation From Digital Guru Jennifer Ewbank
items.excerpt: The former CIA deputy director for digital innovation discusses resilience, cultural shifts, and cyber fundamentals in the AI era.

items.title: The Cloud Edge Is the New Attack Surface
items.excerpt: The cloud now acts as the connecting infrastructure for many companies' assets — from IoT devices to workstations to applications and workloads — exposing the edge to threats.

items.title: 'Scattered Lapsus$ Hunters,' Others Announce End of Hacking Spree
items.excerpt: Though the groups have shared their decision to go dark, threat researchers say there are signs that it's business as usual.

items.title: Raven Stealer Scavenges Chromium Data Via Telegram
items.excerpt: The new lightweight stealer, distributed via underground forums and cracked software, demonstrates an important evolution in the stealth of commodity infostealing malware.

items.title: North Korean Group Targets South With Military ID Deepfakes
items.excerpt: The North Korea-linked group Kimsuky used ChatGPT to create deepfakes of military ID documents in an attempt to compromise South Korean targets.

items.title: Microsoft Disrupts 'RaccoonO365' Phishing Service

items.title: Mastering Digital Breadcrumbs to Stay Ahead of Evolving Threats
items.excerpt: Digital forensics offers a challenging but rewarding career path for cybersecurity professionals willing to invest in specialized knowledge and continuous learning.

items.title: AI-Powered Sign-up Fraud Is Scaling Fast
items.excerpt: The AI era means attackers are smarter, faster, and hitting you where you least expect it — your sign-up funnel.

items.excerpt: Researchers say the commercial adtech platform and several other companies form the infrastructure of a massive cybercrime operation.
